distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for openssl fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2016-2108: Memory corruption in the ASN.1 encoder (bsc#977617)
- CVE-2016-2107: Padding oracle in AES-NI CBC MAC check (bsc#977616)
- CVE-2016-2105: EVP_EncodeUpdate overflow (bsc#977614)
- CVE-2016-2106: EVP_EncryptUpdate overflow (bsc#977615)
- CVE-2016-2109: ASN.1 BIO excessive memory allocation (bsc#976942)
- bsc#976943: Buffer overrun in ASN1_parse
- bsc#977621: Preserve negotiated digests for SNI (bsc#977621)
- bsc#958501: Fix openssl enc -non-fips-allow option in FIPS mode (bsc#958501)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Integer overflow in the EVP_EncodeUpdate function in crypto/evp/encode.c in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a large amount of binary data.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: The AES-NI implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h does not consider memory allocation during a certain padding check, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive cleartext information via a padding-oracle attack against an AES CBC session. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2013-0169.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: The ASN.1 implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1o and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2c allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer underflow and memory corruption) via an ANY field in crafted serialized data, aka the "negative zero" issue.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: The asn1_d2i_read_bio function in crypto/asn1/a_d2i_fp.c in the ASN.1 BIO implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a short invalid encoding.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
